# Arpeggio: Major 7b5 in C# (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The Major 7b5 arpeggio in the key of C# consists of the notes C# (Root), E#, G#, and B. Also known as the C#maj7b5 arpeggio, this musical entity adds a rich and complex flavor to compositions when played over chords or as standalone phrases.

## Notes and Intervals
- C# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G# (Diminished 5th)
- B (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7b5 arpeggio is often used in jazz, fusion, and contemporary music styles. It offers a sense of tension and sophistication to compositions, adding a unique twist to chord progressions and melodic lines. The dissonant interval of the diminished 5th creates a distinct color that can evoke both intrigue and beauty in music.

3. **Song:** "The Fusion Experiment" by Allan Holdsworth
